CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 6, 1959, pg. 6, 7, reads: "'A Home Show Named Success' must be the appropriate label tagged to the ninth annual Courier Home Service Fair, held at the massive Syria Mosque, last Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday nights. This will be the most talked about 'Fair' ever.  From the opening night when thousands began to gather at the doors, to the final session, when the laughter of prize winners waved emotionally with the disappointed non-winners, the exhibitors and participants worked enthusiastically from their national and local booths to accommodate the happy homemakers.  Beautifully decorated booths, sweet organ music augmented by the 'rock 'em, sock 'em' jazz of Sarah McLawler's combo, set the mood for the huge audiences... (8) The modern and attractive Bell Telephone Company of Pennsylvania booth drew many oohs and aahs for their colorful telephones.  Booth attendants were Doris Mixon and Bobetta Johnson, service representative... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Doris Thomas Mixon and Bobetta Johnson seated in booth with telephones advertising Bell Telephone, at 1959 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair, Syria Mosque
